input: Sometimes, math and physics conspire in ways that just feel too good to be true.
from_community_srt: Ponekad se matematika i fizika udruže na načine koji se čine jednostavno previše dobrim da bi bili istiniti.

input: Let's play a strange sort of mathematical croquet.
from_community_srt: Hajde da odigramo čudan matematički kroket*.

input: We're going to have two sliding blocks and a wall.
from_community_srt: (*nije isto što i kriket) Imaćemo dva klizeća bloka i zid.

input: The first block starts by coming in at some velocity from the right, while the second one starts out stationary.
from_community_srt: Prvi blok na početku nailazi nekom brzinom zdesna, dok drugi na početku miruje.

input: Being overly idealistic physicists, let's assume there's no friction and all of the collisions are perfectly elastic, which means no energy is lost.
from_community_srt: Kako smo previše idealizujući fizičari, hajde da pretpostavimo da nema trenja i da su svi sudari savršeno elastični, što znači da nema gubitka energije.

input: The astute among you might complain that such collisions would make no sound, but your goal here is to count how many collisions take place, so in slight conflict with that assumption I want to leave a little clack sound to better draw your attention to that count.
from_community_srt: Pronicljivi među vama bi mogli da zamere da takvi sudari ne bi proizvodili nikakav zvuk, ali vaš zadatak će biti da izbrojite koliko sudara se desilo, tako da uz malu protivurečnost u odnosu na pretpostavku, želim da ostavim mali kliktavi zvuk da bih bolje privukao vašu pažnju na brojanje.

input: The simplest case is when both blocks have the same mass.
from_community_srt: Najjednostavniji slučaj je kada su oba bloka iste mase.

input: The first block hits the second, transferring all of its momentum, then the second one bounces off the wall, and then transfers all of its momentum back to the first, which then sails off towards infinity.
from_community_srt: Prvi blok udara drugog, prenoseći svu svoju silu kretanja. Potom se drugi odbija od zida, i prenosi svu svoju silu kretanja nazad na prvog, koji zatim odjezdi prema beskraju.

input: Three total clacks.
from_community_srt: Tri kliktaja ukupno.

input: What about if the first block was 100 times the mass of the second one?

I promise I will explain to you all the relevant physics in due course, it's not entirely obvious how you would predict the dynamics here, but in the spirit of getting to the punchline, let's watch what happens.
from_community_srt: Šta bude ako taj prvi blok ima masu 100 puta veću od drugog? Obećavam da ću objasniti svu potrebnu fiziku u odgovarajućem trenutku, nije potpuno očigledno kako predvideti dinamiku ovde, ali u duhu stizanja do poente hajde da pogledamo šta se dešava.

input: The second one will keep bouncing back and forth between the wall and the first block, 100 times its mass, like a satisfying game of Breakout, slowly and discreetly redirecting that first block's momentum to point in the opposite direction.
from_community_srt: Drugi blok će nastaviti da se odbija tamo-amo između zida i prvog bloka 100 puta veće mase, kao u zadovoljavajućoj igri "Loptice i Zida od cigli", polako i diskretno preusmeravajući pravac sile kretanja prvog bloka u suprotan smer.

input: In total, there will be 31 collisions before each block is sliding off towards infinity, never to be touched again.
from_community_srt: Ukupno, desiće se 31 sudar pre nego što svaki blok nastavi da kliza ka beskraju, da se nikada više ne dodirnu.

input: What if the first block was 10,000 times the mass of the second one?
from_community_srt: Šta ako je prvi blok 10.000 puta veće mase od drugog? U tom slučaju,

input: In that case, there would be quite a few more clacks, all happening very rapidly at one point, adding up and all to 313 total collisions.
from_community_srt: bilo bi prilično mnogo kliktaja i svi bi se odigravali veoma hitro u jednom trenutku dodajući ukupno 313 sudara.

input: Well, actually, hang on.
from_community_srt: U stvari, samo malo...

input: Wait for it.
Wait for it.
from_community_srt: čekajte... čekajte...

input: Okay, 314 clacks.
from_community_srt: u redu - 314 kliktaja.

input: If the first block was 1,000,000 times the mass of the other, then again, with all of our crazy idealistic conditions, almost all of the clacks happen in one big burst, this time resulting in a total of 3,141 collisions.
from_community_srt: Ako bi prvi blok bio milion puta veće mase od drugog onda bi se, da ponovim, sa svim našim idealističnim uslovima, skoro svi kliktaji desili u jednom velikom prasku, ovog puta rezultirajući sa ukupno 3.141-im sudarom.

input: Perhaps you see the pattern here, though it's forgivable if you don't, since it defies all expectation.
from_community_srt: Možda vidite obrazac ovde, mada je oprostivo i ako ne vidite s obzirom da se protivi svim očekivanjima.

input: When the mass of that first block is some power of 100 times the mass of the second, the total number of collisions have the same digits as pi.
from_community_srt: Kada je masa prvog bloka jednaka nekom stepenu broja 100, pomnoženim sa masom drugog, ukupan broj sudara ima iste cifre kao i Pi.

input: This absolutely blew my mind when it was first shared with me.
from_community_srt: Ovo  me je prosto-naprosto raspametilo kada mi je po prvi put saopšteno.

input: Credit to the viewer Henry Cavill for introducing me to this fact, which was originally discovered by the mathematician Gregory Galperin in 1995 and published in 2003.
from_community_srt: Odajem priznanje gledaocu Henriju Kavlu koji me upoznao sa ovom činjenicom, koju je prvobitno otkrio matematičar Gregori Galperin 1995. godine,

input: Part of what I love about this is that if ever there were Olympic games for algorithms that compute pi, this one would have to win medals both for being the most elegant, and for being the most comically inefficient.
from_community_srt: a objavio 2003. Deo koji volim u vezi sa ovim je taj da, ako bi postojale Olimpijske igre za algoritme koji izračunavaju Pi ovaj bi morao da osvoji medalje kako za najelegantniji, tako i za najkomičnije neefikasan.

input: I mean, think about the actual algorithm here.
from_community_srt: Mislim, razmislite o algoritmu: Korak 1:

input: Step 1, implement a physics engine.
from_community_srt: Implementirati pogon za fiziku.

input: Step 2, choose the number of digits d of pi you'd like to compute.
from_community_srt: Korak 2: Izaberite broj cifara (d), broja Pi koji bi želeli da izračunate.

input: Step 3, set the mass of one of the blocks to be 100 to the power d-1, then send it travelling on a frictionless surface towards a block of mass 1.
from_community_srt: Korak 3: Postavite masu jednog od blokova da bude 100^{d - 1}, i pošaljite ga da se kreće po površini bez trenja prema bloku mase 1.

input: Step 4, count all of the collisions.
from_community_srt: Korak 4:

input: For example, to calculate only 20 digits of pi, which fits so cleanly on this screen, one block would have to have 100 billion billion billion billion times the mass of the other, which if that small block was 1 kilogram, means the big one has a mass about 10 times that of the supermassive black hole at the center of the Milky Way.
from_community_srt: Izračunajte broj sudara. Tako, na primer, da bi izračunali samo 20 cifara Pi, što staje sasvim fino na ovaj ekran jedan blok bi morao da ima 100 milijardi milijardi milijardi milijardi puta veću masu od drugog, što znači da, ako je mali blok 1 kg, drugi ima masu otprilike 10 puta veću nego supermasivna crna rupa u centru Mlečnog puta.

input: That means you would need to count 31 billion billion collisions.
from_community_srt: To znači da bi morali da izbrojite približno 31 milijardu milijardi sudara,

input: At one point in this virtual process, the frequency of clacks would be around 100 billion billion billion billion clacks per second.
from_community_srt: i u jednom trenutku ovog virtuelnog procesa, učestalost kliktaja bila bi približno 100 milijardi milijardi milijardi milijardi kliktaja u sekundi.

input: So let's just say you would need very good numerical precision to get this working accurately, and it would take a very long time for the algorithm to complete.
from_community_srt: Recimo samo da bi vam bila potrebna veoma dobra numerička preciznost da bi ovo radilo tačno, i algoritmu bi bilo potrebno dosta vremena da završi.

input: I'll emphasize again that this process is way over-idealized, quickly departing from anything that could possibly happen in real physics.
from_community_srt: Istaći ću ponovo da je ovaj proces previše idealizovan, brzo se udaljujući od bilo čega što se može desiti u stvarnoj fizici.

input: But of course, you all know this is not interesting because of its potential as an actual pi computing algorithm or as a pragmatic physics demonstration.
from_community_srt: Ali naravno, svi znate da ovo nije zanimljivo zbog svog potencijala kao stvarni algoritam za izračunavanje Pi, ili kao delotvorna demonstracija fizike.

input: It's mind-boggling because why on earth would pi show up here?
from_community_srt: Zapanjujuće je jer - Zašto bi se, pobogu,

input: And it's in such a weird way too.
from_community_srt: cifre Pi pojavile ovde? I to pride na tako čudan način:

input: Its decimal digits are counting something, but usually pi shows up when its precise value is describing something continuous.
from_community_srt: ovde njegove decimalne cifre broje nešto, ali Pi se uobičajeno pojavljuje kada njegova precizna vrednost prikazuje nešto neprekidno.

input: I will show you why this is true.
from_community_srt: Pokazaću vam zašto je ovo istinito.

input: Where there is pi, there is a hidden circle, and in this case, that hidden circle comes from the conservation of energy.
from_community_srt: Gde imamo Pi, tu je i skriveni krug, a u ovom slučaju taj skriveni krug proizilazi iz očuvanja energije.

input: In fact, you're going to see two separate methods, which are each as stunning and surprising as the fact itself.
from_community_srt: U stvari, videćete dve odvojene metode, od kojih je svaka zadivljujuća i iznenađujuća kao i sama činjenica.

input: Delaying gratification though, I will make you wait until the next video to see what's going on.
from_community_srt: Odlažući zadovoljenje, međutim, primoraću vas da sačekate sledeći video da vidite o čemu se radi.

input: In the meantime, I highly encourage you to take a stab at it yourself, and be social about it.
from_community_srt: U međuvremenu, ohrabrujem vas da burgijate i sami. I budite društveni povodom toga! Teška je zagonetka,

input: It's a hard puzzle, so it never hurts to recruit some other smart minds to the task.
from_community_srt: tako da ne škodi pridobiti neke druge pametne umove za zadatak.

input: Thank you.
from_community_srt: Rešenje će biti postavljeno 20. 1. 2019. za radoznale umove sa prostora Balkana preveo: Aleksandar Milinković
